intro: Jacobaea inops, commonly known as the narrowleaf ragwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture and often a bluish-green hue. Jacobaea inops produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
